item.title: Inside the brand strategy behind the Beckham family drama — and who controls the narrative now
item.description: In a modern crisis, experts say control doesn't always come from speaking louder — but from knowing when, where and how briefly to speak at all.

item.title: Half of Adelaide University's Magill campus to be sold for housing, retirement units, aged care
item.description: South Australia's premier announces the future of Adelaide University's Magill campus, which sits on the boundary of two marginal Liberal-held electorates.

item.title: Where in your home is best to set up a work space?
item.description: From garages to cupboards, we asked experts on things to consider before you choose where to set up a home office.

item.title: Found a PCOS 'cure' on social media? It might not be for you
item.description: Advice on how to "manage", "treat" and "heal" PCOS is easy to come by online, but experts say a more personalised approach is usually what's needed.

item.title: How decluttering your digital streaming subscriptions can save you money this year
item.description: With Australian households now holding an average of 3.7 digital entertainment subscriptions each, doing an audit on what you're using and whether it's providing value can be a good place to start when looking to cut costs.

item.title: Should I take a fish oil supplement for my heart, joints or mood?
item.description: Fish oil is one of the most popular dietary supplements. It's often promoted for protecting the heart, boosting mood, reducing inflammation, and supporting overall health.

item.title: Citizen scientists look for hope as the algal bloom persists
item.description: On Kangaroo Island – where the bloom has washed death ashore for almost a year – a group of citizen scientists are focusing their efforts on "what’s still out there".

item.title: Children with brain cancer given hope in trial of personalised vaccines across eight Australian hospitals
item.description: The four-year trial of about 70 children with "dismal prognoses" in eight hospitals across Australia will test the safety and effectiveness of the experimental treatment designed to harness the immune system to attack a child's tumour.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson offered Jeffrey Epstein woman with 'great body' after his release from prison
item.description: Emails contained in the Epstein files show former British royal Sarah Ferguson told the convicted child sex offender she knew a "single" woman with a "great body" he should meet, weeks after his 2009 release from prison.

item.title: Drought-affected SA farmers able to access low-interest loans of up to $250,000
item.description: The SA government has stepped in with an "unprecedented" offer of direct low-interest loans to farmers hit hard by years of drought.

item.description: Residents of a far west New South Wales community found tens of thousands of dead fish on the banks of Lake Menindee.

item.title: Australian man Michael 'Micky' Hurst dies in Japan while skiing
item.description: Michael Hurst had a medical episode and died on the slopes in Hokkaido, making it three Australians in total that have died in Japan this year.

item.description: K'gari traditional owners have held a smoking ceremony for Piper James, who died on the island last month, to give her spirit a safe passage home.

item.description: From farm to fabric, West Australian cotton growers are finally able to grow, process and export record amounts of cotton locally.

item.description: High levels of lead contamination have been found in dust samples taken from suburban locations close to Nyrstar's Hobart zinc smelter, documents obtained by the ABC show.

item.description: Australian primary producers say they are concerned about the risk of foreign pests crippling entire industries if overseas fishing boats continue to enter the nation's waters illegally.

item.description: A long-running saga in country women's football is set to close as a central Victorian team that had been left without a competition will now be allowed to play in 2026.

item.description: Matchbox Pictures, the local production house behind Dog Park, The Survivors and Secret City, will be closed by its international parent company, Universal International Studios.

item.description: Private health insurance premiums will rise at their fastest rate in almost a decade, after the federal government approved a 4.41 per cent average increase from April.

item.description: The mother of Manly player Keith Titmuss, who died of exertional heat stroke following a 2020 Sea Eagles training session, breaks her silence on her family's multi-million-dollar lawsuit against the NRL club.

item.description: The two-time Democratic presidential hopeful remembered for powerful speeches died peacefully surrounded by loved ones, his family said.

item.description: Australia can no longer catch up with Zimbabwe after it was awarded a point from a rained out match with Ireland.

item.description: British economist Gary Stevenson is on a speaking tour, warning Australia will follow the path of the UK with "poverty exploding" unless politicians deal with inequality.

item.description: Riders embroiled in a dispute over pay and conditions with food delivery company HungryPanda in Sydney say Chinese police have asserted pressure back home to stop them protesting.

item.description: The NSW government hopes to reopen a key east-west transport route by April, as a long-term solution to frequent landslips in the area is explored.

item.description: In the 1990s, a group of Indigenous women were accused of fabricating claims of sacred sites to stop the construction of a bridge south of Adelaide. It was a decision that has impacted a community for decades.

item.description: The wine grape industry in South Australia's Riverland continues to face unprecedented levels of uncertainty, as growers look to exit the industry and turn their land into residential housing.

item.description: Major car brands are staring down the barrel of multi-million-dollar penalties for exceeding their emissions, the first results of the federal government's climate laws for new vehicles have revealed.

item.description: Anti-corruption police have searched a home owned by the former general manager of the state's remote Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara (APY) Lands as part of an ongoing investigation.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's arrest could end monarchy's 'never complain, never explain' mentality
item.description: British royals have lived by the adage "never complain, never explain", but these days, many of their subjects are demanding answers.

item.title: Study to test whether a new helmet will significantly reduce risk of concussion in football players
item.description: A lot of research has gone in to treating concussions, but now scientists are testing a new helmet to see if it can prevent them before they happen.

item.title: Can Angus Taylor get beyond slogans to craft a sound immigration policy?
item.description: The rifts in Australia's social cohesion can be seen in the blow-up over the so-called ISIS brides and their children, who want to come to Australia.

item.title: Amyl and the Sniffers singer in escalating legal battle with photographer
item.description: What began as a photo shoot with champagne, ice cream and humorous glamour shots of Amy Taylor, singer from punk band Amyl and the Sniffers, has escalated into a legal fight over copyright, the US Constitution and an application for a restraining order.

item.title: Coalition willing to help stop passports for IS-linked women— as it happened
item.description: Angus Taylor says the Coalition is willing to help the government strengthen legislation so women with ties to Islamic State are not issued Australian passports.

item.title: More rainfall expected for parts of northern Queensland after wet week
item.description: A risk for further heavy rainfall and thunderstorms is possible in northern parts of the state today and into the weekend.

item.title: Major US fund's credit squeeze could 'blow up' — as it happened
item.description: Shares in US asset manager Blue Owl have fallen sharply after it announced it was having challenges meeting investors' cash demands.

item.title: Donald Trump says Andrew's arrest is a 'shame' for Royal family
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Donald Trump says Andrew's arrest is a 'shame' for Royal family
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Federal authorities target black flights and drug importation in Far North Queensland
item.description: A joint police taskforce has been launched in Far North Queensland to target the importation of illicit drugs, forced labour and sexual servitude.

item.title: Three men, one teen charged over gangland attacks linked to 'Coconut Cartel' conflict
item.description: The group, police allege, have been charged in relation to the shooting of ex-NRL player Matt Utai in Greenacre and a firebombing linked to conflict with the 'Coconut Cartel'.

item.title: Sam Altman and Dario Amodei refuse to hold hands
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Bill Gates pulls out of India AI summit amid Epstein files scrutiny
item.description: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates pulls out of his keynote address at India's AI Impact Summit hours before it was scheduled to take place.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor released under investigation after almost 10 hours in custody
item.description: The former Duke of York has been released under investigation by British police, as officers continue to search his former Windsor home.

item.title: Bangarra Dance Theatre wins Golden Lion at international dance festival Venice Danza 2026
item.description: Indigenous dance company Bangarra Dance Theatre has become the first company and first First Nations performers to receive the Golden Lion at Venice Danza, the international festival of contemporary dance.

item.title: Donald Trump hosts first 'Board of Peace' meeting with new pledges for Gaza
item.description: A group of nations will provide billions of dollars and thousands of troops to rebuild Gaza, according to pledges made at the inaugural meeting of Donald Trump's "Board of Peace".

item.title: Canadian skier Cassie Sharpe's horrific crash in the halfpipe reminds us of Winter Olympics dangers
item.description: As Cassie Sharpe lay motionless on the base of the Livigno halfpipe, the excruciating tension reminded us all that winter Olympians are only ever seconds from disaster.

item.title: Fiji, Palau and Tuvalu set to show world leaders climate change impact ahead of COP31
item.description: Fiji, Palau and Tuvalu look set to host world leaders and climate change ministers in the lead-up to COP31 in a bid to encourage larger countries to accelerate cuts to emissions.

item.title: Is it OK to feed Australia's wild birds?
item.description: Many of us love interacting with and feeding wild birds, but experts say giving them the wrong types of food can do more harm than good.

item.title: Australian exporters could face windfall if Trump tariffs ruled unlawful by US Supreme Court
item.description: Modelling by consulting firm EY Australia shows Australian exporters would be owed more than $1.4 billion in refunds collectively if the US tariffs are struck down.

item.title: Brisbane Broncos lose World Club Challenge to Hull KR 30-24
item.description: After pulling off three straight comebacks to win the NRL premiership, the Brisbane Broncos fall just short of another miracle against Hull KR in the World Club Challenge.

item.title: Indra Brown's Winter Olympics medal contention doesn't remove the reality of school homework
item.description: Sixteen-year-old Indra Brown came into the Winter Olympics as one of the top medal contenders in freeski halfpipe — a status elevated since she finished fourth in qualification — but it still doesn't get her out of maths homework.

item.title: David James Pye found guilty of murdering former Rebels boss Nick Martin after recruiting sniper
item.description: Bikie David Pye is convicted of murder after he paid a trained sniper to assassinate his former friend and ex-Rebels boss Nick Martin in front of horrified onlookers at a drag racing event.

item.title: Timeline of key moments leading to former prince Andrew's arrest
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has for years faced allegations over his contact with Jeffrey Epstein. These key moments led to his arrest on suspicion of misconduct in public office.

item.title: Eric Dane, star of Grey's Anatomy and Euphoria, dies aged 53
item.description: The star was best known for his role as Dr Mark Sloan in long-running medical drama Grey's Anatomy, and as the patriarch of the Jacobs family in teen hit Euphoria.

item.title: The Board of Peace meant to rebuild Gaza may well end up as another monument to Donald Trump
item.description: Unless the Board of Peace begins to focus and genuinely tries to make the world a better place, this may well prove to be yet another monument to Donald Trump.

item.title: Complainant in former Liberal MP Rory Amon's underage sexual assault trial addresses court
item.description: The complainant in the sexual assault trial of former Liberal MP Rory Amon has told a court of the alleged incidents that took place in a car park toilet when he was 13.

item.title: Eileen Gu says JD Vance is 'sweet' for saying she should be competing for US at 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Eileen Gu says she is flattered that JD Vance thinks she should be competing for the US, but feels his comments are driven by an anti-China bias from Washington.

item.title: Racist hate mail sent to politicians bears hallmarks of Lakemba Mosque letters
item.description: The ABC can reveal two of the threatening, hate-filled letters sent to Lakemba Mosque this month bear close resemblance to similar racist letters sent to multiple politicians since 2022.

item.title: Launceston council approve six-storey City Mission social housing project
item.description: Almost 50 new social and affordable homes will be built in Tasmania's north following a green light from council, despite some concern about parking and "anti-social behaviour".

item.title: What to watch, read and listen to this weekend: Eternity, "Wuthering Heights" and new Meg Mac
item.description: From a cursed vagina to a classic retold, there's plenty of culture to dig into this weekend.

item.title: Senior Constable Stuart Parsonage charged with illegal surveillance by WA Police sex crime division
item.description: Geraldton Senior Constable Stuart Parsonage has been charged with the illegal installation of a surveillance device and unlawful use of a computer by WA sex crime detectives.

item.title: Parents speak at sentencing hearing for Christopher Turner over fatal gas mix-up
item.description: The parents of two babies given nitrous oxide in a fatal gas mix-up at a Sydney hospital almost a decade ago express their pain and trauma at the sentencing hearing for the man responsible.

item.title: Mercedes F1 boss Toto Wolff defends team over engine drama ahead of Australian Grand Prix
item.description: Toto Wolff accuses rival Formula 1 manufacturers of ganging up on Mercedes to pressure the governing FIA to change engine rules, but says it will make no difference.

item.title: Coroner delivers findings into James Tsindos's death from allergic reaction to delivery meal
item.description: A Victorian coroner hands down her findings into the death of a teenager who suffered a severe allergic reaction to a delivery meal — but it's unclear if more urgent treatment would have saved his life.

item.title: Kyra Wheatley ready to ride the chaos and speed of ski cross at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: The speed and chaos of ski cross is what attracted Kyra Wheatley to the sport, and to realise a dream 12 years in the making of competing at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Darwin prisoner Clinton Daylight found, returned to custody two days after being freed from jail by mistake
item.description: A 52-year-old inmate who was mistakenly released from the Darwin Correctional Centre two months before his sentence was due to end, due to an "administration error" by prison staff, has been found following a police search.

item.title: Scientists model best-case and worst-case climate scenarios for Antarctica
item.description: Scientists say parts of Antarctica face "devastating" and "irreversible" impacts from climate change unless urgent action is taken to limit greenhouse gas emissions.

item.title: MotoGP Adelaide move raises concerns about rider safety, transport and trees
item.description: A rider, a reporter and a road safety expert say it will be difficult to make it safe for motorcycles to race around the Adelaide Parklands.

item.title: How Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's 10 hours in police custody unfolded
item.description: Ostracised by his family and stripped of his titles, Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor celebrates his 66th birthday with police.

item.title: WA treasury takes rates from forestry plantations, leaving regional WA shires with funding shortfall
item.description: Seven South West councils face $325,000 funding shortfall after forestry rate payments redirected to state Treasury. Shires warn residents could face higher rates or cuts to essential services as they push the state government for a solution.

item.title: Woman who fatally struck 12-year-old Marshall Oakley-Stagg granted restricted driver's licence
item.description: A driver who struck and killed a 12-year-old boy outside his school in southern Tasmania in 2024 has been granted a restricted licence.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on day 14
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Port Pirie's toddlers record highest blood lead levels in a decade
item.description: The percentage of two-year-old children above the blood lead level threshold in Port Pirie is the highest in a decade, according to the latest figures.

item.title: Glider pilot creates aviation history in Central Australia flying 1,266 kilometres
item.description: A Queensland pilot has made aviation history in Central Australia, flying more than 1,200 kilometres without an engine in a record-breaking glider flight launched from Alice Springs.

item.title: Ellyse Perry's evolution cements greatness as Australian cricket milestone looms
item.description: Cricket superstar Ellyse Perry will become the first woman to play 350 matches for Australia across all formats on Saturday.

item.title: Man accused of performing Nazi salute at AFL exploring mental health defence
item.description: Tylere Baker-Pearce, 39, was initially charged with giving the salute at the Gabba, and was later hit with two additional counts of the alleged offence.

item.title: Nurses' strike at Adelaide's Lyell McEwin Hospital cancelled after pay increase ahead of state election start
item.description: The Australian Nursing and Midwifery Federation cancels a strike at one of Adelaide's largest public hospitals after securing a 2 per cent pay rise on top of a 4 per cent immediate increase in wages announced earlier this week.

item.title: Queensland's new chief health officer Marianne Gale outlines future priorities
item.description: Marianne Gale reminisces about her time working for Doctors Without Borders to emphasise how she wants to shape the public health of the state – with a strong focus on equity.

item.title: Newcastle man avoids jail for child abuse images and bestiality videos
item.description: A man has avoided time behind bars and instead been handed a three-year community corrections order for possessing 34,000 child abuse images and more than a dozen bestiality videos.

item.title: Cockroaches peer out of a communications access hole in Adelaide
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Cockroaches peer out of a communications access hole in Adelaide
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Cockroach numbers surge in Adelaide during warm, humid weather
item.description: Adelaide residents have been reporting increased numbers of unwelcome six-legged visitors in their homes, but with humid weather to continue amid a flood warning for the state's north, they are likely to stick around for a while yet.

item.title: Bushfire at Gaffneys Creek in central-east Victoria burning out of control
item.description: Residents in a remote Victorian community have been urged to evacuate as an out-of-control fire rages nearby.

item.title: Licence for use of antibiotic florfenicol in Tasmanian salmon industry may be suspended
item.description: The federal agency that approved the use of an antibiotic for Tasmania's salmon industry has proposed to suspend that licence, in the wake of news the antibiotic has been found in native species.

item.title: Friday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: SA state election polls could lead to one or no seats for Liberal Party, analyst says
item.description: Two opinion polls show fewer South Australians intend to vote for the Liberal Party than One Nation ahead of the official state election campaign period.

item.title: New Zealand man Tamaohungia Joseph Tepatu-Edwards jailed for 26 years for attempted cocaine importation
item.description: A man who tried to smuggle more than 800 kilograms of cocaine into WA – and was only caught when his boat broke down — will spend two decades in jail and "likely" be deported.

item.title: Rottnest Channel Swim cancelled due to strong winds, choppy seas
item.description: Perth's iconic Rottnest Channel Swim has been cancelled as forecast strong winds and unfavourable ocean conditions leaves thousands of swimmers and support crew disappointed.

item.title: Police receive ‘reports of crime’ in relation to Pauline Hanson interview
item.description: One Nation senator Pauline Hanson accuses the government of trying to put her "back in jail", after police received reports of a crime in relation to the senator's inflammatory comments about Muslims during a media interview.

item.title: Live: Wheatley set for Olympic debut as women's ski cross begins
item.description: Australia's only ski cross athlete, Kyra Wheatley, makes her Winter Olympics debut tonight as seeding begins in the women's event. Follow live.

item.title: Trump wants federal agencies to release files on UFOs and extraterrestrials
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he will direct federal agencies to begin "identifying and releasing" government files related to UFOs and aliens.

item.title: Dolphins defeat New Zealand Warriors in NRL trial, Jackson Ford sin-bin for hip-drop tackle
item.description: The New Zealand Warriors' hopes of having no-nonsense forward Jackson Ford on deck for their season opener are in the hands of the NRL's match review committee after he was sin-binned in a 38-34 trial loss to the Dolphins.
